articles.title: Minutes of January 7 Planning Meeting
articles.summary: This document outlines the minutes of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' (SJAA) January 7, 1957, planning meeting, detailing board decisions on new members, by-laws, and plans for a scope tube and large mirror, alongside discussions about professional speakers and club activities. It also provides detailed program schedules for SJAA's monthly meetings from February to May 1957, including topics, speakers, and announcements for upcoming star parties and a Western Amateur Astronomers Convention. The document concludes with a news clip from October 1957, featuring local members searching for Sputnik.

articles.title: January 7 Planning Meeting Memorandum
articles.summary: This document outlines the 1957 activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club, detailing planning meetings, monthly program topics, and upcoming events like star parties and a convention. It covers a range of subjects from telescope making and specific celestial objects to astro-photometry and spectroscopy. The collection concludes with a news item about club members searching for the Sputnik satellite in October 1957.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers February Meeting
articles.summary: This document details the monthly meetings and programs of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club from February to May 1957, covering topics like telescope making, astronomical phenomena, and observing techniques. It also lists various upcoming club events, including star parties and planning meetings, and briefly mentions members searching for the Sputnik satellite in October 1957.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers March Meeting
articles.summary: The document details the monthly meetings (March, April, May 1957) of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, outlining programs that covered astronomical topics such as the Orion Nebula, Astro-Photometry, Vanguard, Comets, and Spectroscopy. It also lists upcoming events including club star parties, planning meetings, an annual election, and the Western Amateur Astronomers Convention. A later note from October 1957 mentions local amateur astronomers searching for the Sputnik satellite.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers April 1 Planning Meeting
articles.summary: The document details the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' meeting schedules and programs for April, May, and upcoming June 1957, featuring talks on topics like "The Vanguard," constellations, and spectroscopy. It also outlines planning meetings, various star parties, and the Western Amateur Astronomers Convention in August. A later entry highlights local club members actively searching the skies for Russia's Sputnik satellite in October 1957.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers April Meeting & Star Party Map
articles.summary: This document details the April and May 1957 meetings and events for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, outlining program topics such as Vanguard, specific constellations, and planets, along with various star party locations and dates. It also includes maps for star parties and a news clipping from October 1957 showing members searching for the Sputnik satellite. The article provides insight into the club's activities and interests during a pivotal year for space exploration.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers May Meeting
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club announced their April and May 1957 meetings, featuring programs on celestial objects like constellations and planets, Vanguard, and spectroscopy, alongside plans for local star parties and a regional convention. The document also includes a news report from October 1957 highlighting local amateur astronomers actively searching the skies for Russia's newly launched Sputnik satellite.

articles.title: Star Gazers Search For Satellite
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers are actively planning and hosting various events, including star parties, monthly meetings with educational programs on constellations, planets, and spectroscopy, and an annual election. A notable event features local amateur astronomers Carl Hart, Ira Randall, and Frank Galvin searching for Russia's Sputnik satellite, though they had not yet sighted it at the time of the report. The article also lists an upcoming Western Amateur Astronomers Convention.
